comments.body:
The `default` here previously was `True` now `None`.  The docs state that this is boolean, and the default is `True`.

I assume setting it to `None` changes the behavior in a non-backwards compatible way.
This also applies to the other `_enabled` arguments, where they previously defaulted to `True` and are documented as such.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +603,607 @@            alert_cpu_enabled = dict(type='bool', default=None),
            alert_cpu_threshold = dict(type='int', default=None),
            alert_diskio_enabled = dict(type='bool', default=None),
            alert_diskio_threshold = dict(type='int', default=None),
            backupsenabled = dict(type='int', default=None),

comments.body: I'm not sure about changing the defaults...

@s-hertel I changed the defaults back to how they were. In IRC it was pointed out that it was a subtle behavior change. So this whole branch has been to fix the issues and make it as backwards compatible as possible.

Now instead of passing in values if they're not needed, nothing is sent it which is how it was originally since those variables were never defined.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +595,599 @@            api_key = dict(no_log=True),
            name = dict(type='str'),
            alert_bwin_enabled = dict(type='bool', default=None),
            alert_bwin_threshold = dict(type='int', default=None),
            alert_bwout_enabled = dict(type='bool', default=None),

comments.body: ^^^ You can disregard that comment. It appears to be working as desired.

I can move them to kwargs at this point. I'm open to either way. Originally my goal was as few changes as possible to just fix bugs, then saw the behavior was completely different and had to rewrite to the splatting to get desired results.

diffHunk:

                api.linode_update(LinodeId=linode_id,
                        LPM_DISPLAYGROUP=displaygroup, WATCHDOG=watchdog, **kwargs)
                # Save server
                servers = api.linode_list(LinodeId=linode_id)
